text: Select the proper screw for the job. Make sure it is long enough and strong enough. Mark the hole location accurately. Use a cross (+). Drill a pilot hole in the center of the cross.  Make a larger, shallow hole to countersink. This is not for flat head screws. Start the screw with a hand driver. Finish with a power driver -- but resist the temptation to drive with too much speed, as sharp screw threads can act as a drill bit and strip the screw hole.
